q: What’s the difference between training and inference?
choices: Training happens once; inference happens each time the system is used
Inference creates data; training deletes data
explain: Training learns from datasets; inference serves users and produces outputs on demand.

q: Which is the BEST way to reduce hallucinations?
choices: Ask the model to be more confident
Use RAG to ground answers in trusted documents
explain: Retrieval-Augmented Generation supplies sources that the model can cite and stick to.

q: What should leaders do about prompts that may contain PII?
choices: Mask or avoid sending PII; use approved environments
Only send PII after business hours
explain: Minimize/obfuscate sensitive data and use approved systems for any processing.
